TValueValidator Class Reference

Abstract class which is used as the base for all value validators. More...

#include <iisValidators.h>

Inheritance diagram for TValueValidator:

List of all members.

enum  EValidateResult { VR_BAD, VR_OK, VR_FIXED }

 TValueValidator (QObject *parent=0)
virtual EValidateResult checkValue (QVariant &value)=0

Detailed Description

Abstract class which is used as the base for all value validators.

Validators are used for check input from the user.

Every validator should reimplement checkValue(QString& value) method. This method checks input (normally passed from item editor) and returns a result of the validation (see EValidateResult enum). If the validator can fix invalid value, it should write correct value back to and return VR_FIXED. If the value can not be fixed, it should return VR_BAD. If the value is good, it should return VR_OK respectively.

See also:
checkValue()

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TValueValidator::EValidateResult

Enumerator:
VR_BAD  means that validation has failed.
VR_OK  means that validation has passed.
VR_FIXED  means that validated value has corrected automatically during validation.

Member Function Documentation

virtual EValidateResult TValueValidator::checkValue ( QVariant &  value  )  [pure virtual]

This method checks input (normally passed from item editor) and returns a result of the validation (see EValidateResult enum).

If the validator can fix invalid value, it should write correct value back to and return VR_FIXED. If the value can not be fixed, it should return VR_BAD. If the value is good, it should return VR_OK respectively.

Implemented in TIntValidator, TDoubleValidator, TRegExpValidator, TColorValidator, TPointValidator, TSizeValidator, TRectValidator, and TRangeValidator.
